message.content:
The length of a notepad would depend on several factors, including the size of the original paper, how many times it is folded and cut, and how much space is used up with each note. Assuming that a single piece of paper is about 0.1 m x 0.07 m (about 6.8 cm x 4.9 cm) and that this is being folded and cut three times to make a notepad note, the size of each notepad note would be about 0.03 m x 0.025 m (about 1.2 cm x 1 cm).

If someone writes ten notes per day on one notepad, then the length of one notepad will last for about 10 / 10 = 1 day. This is because each note takes up the same amount of space and there are ten spaces available. Therefore, if she continues to use this method, she would need to make a new notepad every day.
